meanings.definition: A signal that comes before another signal.
meanings.sent1: The presignals of the approaching storm were dark clouds on the horizon.
meanings.sent2: The traffic light changing to yellow is a presignals for drivers to slow down.
meanings.sent3: The presignals of a surprise party can be hard to keep secret.
meanings.sent4: The sudden drop in temperature was a presignals of the impending snowstorm.
meanings.sent5: The chirping of birds in the morning serves as presignals of a new day.

meanings.definition: To give a signal before something happens.
meanings.sent1: The coach presignals the start of the race with a whistle.
meanings.sent2: She presignals her arrival by sending a text message.
meanings.sent3: The dog presignals its excitement by wagging its tail.
meanings.sent4: The teacher presignals the end of class by packing up her things.
meanings.sent5: The alarm clock presignals the beginning of a new day with its loud ring.
